009package imagingbook.common.regions.segment;
010
011import java.awt.Rectangle;
012import java.util.Iterator;
013import java.util.LinkedList;
014import java.util.List;
015import java.util.NoSuchElementException;
016
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
018import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
019import imagingbook.common.regions.BinaryRegion;
020import imagingbook.common.regions.Contour;
021
022/**
023 * Binary region backed by the label array of a region segmenter.
024 * A {@link SegmentationBackedRegion} instance does not have its own list or array of 
025 * contained pixel coordinates but refers to the label array of the
026 * enclosing {@link BinaryRegionSegmentation} instance.
027 */
028public class SegmentationBackedRegion extends BinaryRegion {
029
030        private final int label;                                                                        // the label of this region
031        private final BinaryRegionSegmentation segmentation;            // the segmentation backing this region
032        private int size = 0;
033        private int left = Integer.MAX_VALUE;
034        private int right = -1;
035        private int top = Integer.MAX_VALUE;
036        private int bottom = -1;
037
038        private Contour outerContour = null;
039        private List<Contour> innerContours = null;
040
041        // summation variables used for various statistics
042        private long x1Sum = 0;
043        private long y1Sum = 0;
044        private long x2Sum = 0;
045        private long y2Sum = 0;
046        private long xySum = 0;
047
048        // ------- constructor --------------------------
049
050        SegmentationBackedRegion(int label, BinaryRegionSegmentation seg) {
051                this.label = label;
052                this.segmentation = seg;
053        }
054
055        // ------- public methods --------------------------
056
057        protected int getLabel() {
058                return this.label;
059        }
060
061        @Override
062        public int getSize() {
063                return this.size;
064        }
065        
066        @Override
067        public long getX1Sum() {
068                return x1Sum;
069        }
070
071        @Override
072        public long getY1Sum() {
073                return y1Sum;
074        }
075
076        @Override
077        public long getX2Sum() {
078                return x2Sum;
079        }
080
081        @Override
082        public long getY2Sum() {
083                return y2Sum;
084        }
085
086        @Override
087        public long getXYSum() {
088                return xySum;
089        }
090
091        /**
092         * Get the x/y axes-parallel bounding box as a rectangle
093         * (including the extremal coordinates).
094         * @return the bounding box rectangle.
095         */
096        @Override
097        public Rectangle getBoundingBox() {
098                if (right < 0)
099                        return null;
100                else
101                        return new Rectangle(left, top, right-left + 1, bottom - top + 1);
102        }
103
104        @Override
105        public Iterator<Pnt2d> iterator() {
106                return new RegionPixelIterator();
107        }
108
109        /**
110         * Adds a single pixel to this region and updates summation
111         * and boundary variables used to calculate various region statistics.
112         * 
113         * @param u x-position
114         * @param v y-position
115         */
116        protected void addPixel(int u, int v) {
117                size = size + 1;
118                x1Sum = x1Sum + u;
119                y1Sum = y1Sum + v;
120                x2Sum = x2Sum + u * u;
121                y2Sum = y2Sum + v * v;
122                xySum = xySum + u * v;
123                if (u < left)   left = u;
124                if (v < top)    top = v;
125                if (u > right)  right = u;
126                if (v > bottom) bottom = v;
127        }
128
129        /**
130         * Updates the region's statistics. 
131         * Does nothing but may be overridden by inheriting classes.
132         */
133        protected void update() {
134        }
135
136        /**
137         * Get the (single) outer contour of this region.
138         * Points on an outer contour are arranged in clockwise
139         * order.
140         * @return the outer contour.
141         */
142        @Override
143        public Contour getOuterContour() {
144                return outerContour;
145        }
146
147        public void setOuterContour(Contour.Outer contr) {
148                outerContour = contr;
149        }
150
151        /**
152         * Get all inner contours of this region.
153         * Points on inner contours are arranged in counter-clockwise order.
154         * @return the list of inner contours.
155         */
156        @Override
157        public List<Contour> getInnerContours() {       // sort!!!
158                return innerContours;
159        }
160
161        public void addInnerContour(Contour.Inner contr) {
162                if (innerContours == null) {
163                        innerContours = new LinkedList<>();
164                }
165                innerContours.add(contr);
166        }
167
168        /**
169         * Checks if the given pixel position is contained in this
170         * {@link SegmentationBackedRegion} instance.
171         * @param u x-coordinate
172         * @param v y-coordinate
173         * @return true if (u,v) is contained in this region
174         */
175        @Override
176        public boolean contains(int u, int v) {
177                return segmentation.getLabel(u, v) == this.label;
178        }
179        
180//      @Override
181//      public String toString() {
182//              Formatter fm = new Formatter(new StringBuilder(), Locale.US);
183//              fm.format("Region %d", label);
184//              fm.format(", area = %d", size);
185//              fm.format(", bounding box = (%d, %d, %d, %d)", left, top, right, bottom );
186//              fm.format(", centroid = (%.2f, %.2f)", xc, yc);
187//              if (innerContours != null)
188//                      fm.format(", holes = %d", innerContours.size());
189//              String s = fm.toString();
190//              fm.close();
191//              return s;
192//      }
193
194        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
195
196        /**
197         * Instances of this class are returned by {@link SegmentationBackedRegion#iterator()},
198         * which implements  {@link Iterable} for instances of class {@link Pnt2d}.
199         */
200        private class RegionPixelIterator implements Iterator<Pnt2d> {
201                private final int label;                                        // the corresponding region's label
202                private final int uMin, uMax, vMin, vMax;       // coordinates of region's bounding box
203                private int uCur, vCur;                                         // current pixel position
204                private PntInt pNext;                                           // coordinates of the next region pixel
205                private boolean first;                                          // control flag
206
207                RegionPixelIterator() {
208                        label = SegmentationBackedRegion.this.getLabel();
209                        Rectangle bb = SegmentationBackedRegion.this.getBoundingBox();
210                        first = true;
211                        uMin = bb.x;
212                        uMax = bb.x + bb.width;
213                        vMin = bb.y;
214                        vMax = bb.y + bb.height;
215                        uCur = uMin;
216                        vCur = vMin;
217                        pNext = null;
218                }
219
220                /** 
221                 * Search from position (uCur, vCur) for the next valid region pixel.
222                 * Return the next position as a Point or null if no such point can be found.
223                 * Don't assume that (uCur, vCur) is a valid region pixel!
224                 * 
225                 * @return the next point
226                 */
227                private Pnt2d.PntInt findNext() {
228                        // start search for next region pixel at (u,v):
229                        int u = (first) ? uCur : uCur + 1;
230                        int v = vCur;
231                        first = false;
232                        while (v <= vMax) {
233                                while (u <= uMax) {
234                                        if (segmentation.getLabel(u, v) == label) { // next pixel found (uses surrounding labeling)
235                                                uCur = u;
236                                                vCur = v;
237                                                return PntInt.from(uCur, vCur);
238                                        }
239                                        u++;
240                                }
241                                v++;
242                                u = uMin;
243                        }
244                        uCur = uMax + 1;        // just to make sure we'll never enter the loop again
245                        vCur = vMax + 1;
246                        return null;            // no next pixel found
247                }
248
249                @Override
250                public boolean hasNext() {
251                        if (pNext != null) {    // next element has been queried before but not consumed
252                                return true;
253                        }
254                        else {
255                                pNext = findNext();     // keep next pixel coordinates in pNext
256                                return (pNext != null);
257                        }
258                }
259
260                // Returns: the next element in the iteration
261                // Throws: NoSuchElementException - if the iteration has no more elements.
262                @Override
263                public PntInt next() {
264                        if (pNext != null || hasNext()) {
265                                PntInt pn = pNext;
266                                pNext = null;           // "consume" pNext
267                                return pn;
268                        }
269                        else {
270                                throw new NoSuchElementException();
271                        }
272                }
273
274                @Override
275                public void remove() {
276                        throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
277                }
278
279        } // end of class RegionPixelIterator
280
281} // end of class BinaryRegion
